fields.headline: Michael Holden's all ears
fields.bodyText: I was struggling to operate the watercooler in the entrance hall of a business centre when a courier walked in and approached the receptionist, a woman in her 50s with candyfloss hair who it transpired could have single-handedly paved the road to hell with just one of her good intentions. Courier: (Removing his helmet) "Do you have any mail for us?" Receptionist "No dear." Then suddenly looking up and noting the colour of his skin. "Actually, yes - I have seen something. Er... it's for a Mr Akuja. Would that be you dear?" Courier: "It's from Akuja, and yes, that's it." Receptionist: (handing over the package) What part of the world are you originally from, dear?" Courier: "Nigeria." Receptionist: (excited) "Did you seen that programme on TV last night - The Last Slave? It was very good." Courier: (unmoved) "I don't have a TV." Receptionist: (undeterred) "Don't you dear? It was very interesting. Did you know it wasn't just the white men who trafficked in slaves?" Courier: "I don't watch TV, I only listen to the radio." Receptionist: (pointing at TV screen, where they were talking about senator Barack Obama) "Then you must have heard about him. Did you know that his great-great-grandfather had 50 slaves or something?" Courier: (leaving) "I've gotta go." Receptionist: (calling after him) "It's shocking though, isn't it?" As he strode purposefully past I hoped that the sheer force of my own self-consciousness might somehow make me invisible.
